commitResults.messageTitle: Add Attend command for marking attendance
commitResults.messageBody:
Implements parsing for the attend command with
  format:
  attend n/NAME session/SESSION_ID
  status/PRESENT|ABSENT

  - Add PREFIX_SESSION and PREFIX_STATUS to CliSyntax
  - Create AttendCommand with placeholder execute logic
  - Create AttendCommandParser with status validation
  - Register attend command in AddressBookParser

  No business logic implemented yet - command currently
   echoes parsed values.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change role from Developer to Team Lead
Update DeveloperGuide requirements sections for TutBook
commitResults.messageBody:
- Update Product Scope with tuition centre admin target profile
- Add comprehensive User Stories covering all major features
- Add 6 detailed Use Cases with extensions
- Expand Non-Functional Requirements to 31 items across 9 categories
- Add comprehensive Glossary with TutBook-specific terms

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix DeveloperGuide issues identified in review
commitResults.messageBody:
User Stories:
- Change update teachers to update any contact (more general)

Use Cases:
- Add UC05 Edit Contact (important use case with multiple extensions)
- Fix UC06 Delete Contact (remove confirmation step not in MVP)
- Renumber subsequent use cases

Non-Functional Requirements:
- Remove uptime requirement (not applicable for desktop app)
- Change backup requirement to data integrity validation
- Remove future enhancement mention from batch operations
- Add Data Integrity Requirements section (3 new NFRs)
- Fix numbering for Accessibility Requirements

Glossary:
- Remove Private contact detail (not relevant to TutBook)
- Add missing technical terms: CLI, CRUD, JSON, MSS

commitResults.messageTitle: Update DeveloperGuide requirements sections for TutBook (#26)
commitResults.messageBody:
* Update DeveloperGuide requirements sections for TutBook

- Update Product Scope with tuition centre admin target profile
- Add comprehensive User Stories covering all major features
- Add 6 detailed Use Cases with extensions
- Expand Non-Functional Requirements to 31 items across 9 categories
- Add comprehensive Glossary with TutBook-specific terms

* Fix DeveloperGuide issues identified in review

User Stories:
- Change update teachers to update any contact (more general)

Use Cases:
- Add UC05 Edit Contact (important use case with multiple extensions)
- Fix UC06 Delete Contact (remove confirmation step not in MVP)
- Renumber subsequent use cases

Non-Functional Requirements:
- Remove uptime requirement (not applicable for desktop app)
- Change backup requirement to data integrity validation
- Remove future enhancement mention from batch operations
- Add Data Integrity Requirements section (3 new NFRs)
- Fix numbering for Accessibility Requirements

Glossary:
- Remove Private contact detail (not relevant to TutBook)
- Add missing technical terms: CLI, CRUD, JSON, MSS

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Role field infrastructure for contact types
commitResults.messageBody:
- Created Role class with validation for student/tutor/parent values
- Added PREFIX_ROLE constant to CliSyntax for command parsing support

This change provides the foundational infrastructure needed for TutBook
to distinguish between different contact types as required in the MVP.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix formatting: Add newline at end of Role.java file
Fix duplicate PREFIX_ROLE definition after merge
commitResults.messageBody:
- Merged upstream changes that added PREFIX_ROLE with 'ro/' prefix
- Removed duplicate PREFIX_ROLE definition to fix compilation error
- Keeping upstream's PREFIX_ROLE definition for consistency

commitResults.messageTitle: Add comprehensive test coverage for Role class
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added RoleTest.java with full test coverage
- Tests constructor validation and null handling
- Tests isValidRole() with various inputs (valid/invalid)
- Tests case-insensitive validation
- Tests equals(), hashCode(), and toString() methods
- Ensures all 14 lines of Role.java are covered by tests

- Implement EditClassCommand to rename existing classes
- Implement DeleteClassCommand to remove classes
- Add necessary methods to Model, ModelManager, AddressBook, and UniqueClassList
- Add command parsers for both new commands
- Register commands in AddressBookParser
- Add unit tests for both commands

commitResults.messageTitle: Add comprehensive tests and fix EditClass parser for space-separated class names
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add integration tests for EditClass and DeleteClass commands
- Add parser tests with comprehensive edge case coverage
- Fix EditClassCommandParser to use prefix-based parsing (o/ and c/)
  to properly handle class names containing spaces
- Add PREFIX_OLD_CLASS and PREFIX_CLASS to CliSyntax
- Add hashCode() methods to EditClassCommand and DeleteClassCommand
- Update MESSAGE_USAGE in EditClassCommand to reflect new prefix format
- Add test cases for class names with spaces in both old and new names
- Add manual test script for command verification

commitResults.messageTitle: Replace Java assert with JUnit assertions in integration tests
commitResults.messageBody:
- Replace assert() with assertTrue() for positive assertions
- Replace assert(!...) with assertFalse() for negative assertions
- Add missing imports for assertTrue and assertFalse
- Ensures tests will actually catch regressions when assertions are evaluated

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve command documentation with prefix explanations and space support
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add clear explanation of o/ and c/ prefixes in EditClassCommand
- Clarify that class names can contain spaces
- Add example with spaces for both commands
- Improve MESSAGE_USAGE readability

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve UI to support roles for each entry

commitResults.messageBody:
- Implement LinkCommand for bidirectional parent-child linking
  - Add link command to establish parent-child relationships
  - Syntax: link parent/PARENT_NAME child/CHILD_NAME
  - Validates person types and prevents duplicate links
  - Uses existing addChild() method for bidirectional linking

- Enhance HelpCommand to list all available commands
  - Display comprehensive command list with usage syntax
  - Shows all 16 commands when user types 'help'

- Add comprehensive test coverage
  - LinkCommandTest with 10 test cases
  - LinkCommandParserTest with 10 test cases
  - All tests passing with proper coverage
